sentence.Network_en: She returns to the big screen to play Candy's overbearing mother, Rose.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又重返大银幕，扮演坎迪专横的母亲罗丝。

sentence.Network_en: He's so overbearing that no one wants to work for him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那么专横,没人愿为他工作.

sentence.Network_en: Promoted too quickly, the conceited young man became overbearing.
sentence.Network_cn: 提拔得太快, 那个自负的年轻人变得盛气凌人.

[overbearing airs] 骄傲自大的习气(1).骄傲的气势、态度。《史记·老子韩非列传》:“去子之骄气与多欲,态色与淫志,是皆无益于子之身。”宋陆游《新岁颇.
they are consigned to a life of fiddling with contraptions in the hopes of somehow discovering a way of pleasing their overbearing mate .他们平时的生活就是制作精巧的设计来取悦自己傲慢的配偶。
a woman considered to be spiteful or overbearing ., 泼妇被认为坏脾气或专横的女人.
In a pretentiously arrogant and overbearing manner ., 不可一世的以狂妄地傲慢和专横的态度的.

entry.tran: 傲慢的；专横的；盛气凌人的；飞扬跋扈的
entry.def: An overbearing person tries to make other people do what he or she wants in an unpleasant and forceful way.

example.ex: My husband can be quite overbearing with our son.
example.tran: 我丈夫有时对儿子很专横。

auth_sentence.content: The Pilgrims were overbearing in matters of religion.
